comments.body:
~won't this give different behaviour compared to `frozenset` above if `.items()` is non unique?~ nvmd, frozenset below ... which makes me think this change is either a noop or it is changing which k value survives?

update will add each element of the tuple to the set, while add adds the tuple itself to the set, so this does seem like a correct change.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@                for k, v in params.items():
                    # Hash each entry individually
                    new_params.add((k, hash_params(v)))
                new_params = frozenset(new_params)
